body_html:
I have faced the similar issue while I was running HPM resnet50 benchmark with Tensorflow-1.5.0. But this does not occurs always. It occurs randomly.

OS Platform and Distribution: RHEL 7.4
TensorFlow installed from: Tensorflow 1.5.0 tag and build myself
TensorFlow version: v1.5.0
Bazel version: 0.8.0
CUDA/cuDNN version: CUDA-9.1.85 and CuDNN 7.1.1
GPU model and memory: Tesla V100-SXM2-16GB

Exact command to reproduce:
$ git clone https://github.com/tensorflow/benchmarks.git
$ cd benchmarks
$ git checkout f5d85aef2851881001130b28385795bc4c59fa38
$ cd scripts/tf_cnn_benchmarks/

$ python tf_cnn_benchmarks.py --num_batches=200 --num_gpus=4 --model=resnet50 --batch_size=64 --local_parameter_device=gpu --variable_update=replicated --data_name=imagenet --data_dir=/data/TF_records

body:
I have faced the similar issue while I was running HPM resnet50 benchmark with Tensorflow-1.5.0. But this does not occurs always. It occurs randomly.

OS Platform and Distribution: RHEL 7.4
TensorFlow installed from: Tensorflow 1.5.0 tag and build myself
TensorFlow version: v1.5.0
Bazel version: 0.8.0
CUDA/cuDNN version: CUDA-9.1.85 and CuDNN 7.1.1
GPU model and memory: Tesla V100-SXM2-16GB

Exact command to reproduce:
$ git clone https://github.com/tensorflow/benchmarks.git
$ cd benchmarks
$ git checkout f5d85aef2851881001130b28385795bc4c59fa38
$ cd scripts/tf_cnn_benchmarks/

$ python tf_cnn_benchmarks.py --num_batches=200 --num_gpus=4 --model=resnet50 --batch_size=64 --local_parameter_device=gpu --variable_update=replicated --data_name=imagenet --data_dir=/data/TF_records
